newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to announce qualified B Band bidders June 4.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to announce qualified B Band bidders June 4.

text.p: The Brazilian government will release June 4 the names of quailfied bidders on concessions to operate cellular services on Brazil's B Band frequency, an official said.

Communications Ministry spokesman Francisco Mendonca said an advertisement will be placed May 30 in the government's official gazette Diario Oficial da Uniao inviting bidding consortia to attend the announcement.
Mendonca said disqualified consortia will have five days to appeal, after which the government will open the tender envelopes for the first two concession areas: Area One and Area Seven.
Area One covers the city of Sao Paulo and Area Seven covers Brazil's central western region, including Brasilia and the states of Goias, Acre, Rondonia and Tocantins.
Once the winning bidders are announced, the consortia will be handed a contract and given 10 days to sign.
After areas one and seven, the government will open envelopes for areas two and eight, then three and nine, then five and last area six.
Mendonca said the last of the contracts could be signed in anywhere from two months to seven months.
"In the worst of worlds, it could be the end of the year. In the best, maybe two months," he said.
